quiz.title: Foundations of Algebra (Quiz 9)
quiz.subtitle: Unit 1 Quiz 9: Square and Cube Roots (10 Questions)
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Finding Square Roots and Cube Roots

questions.question: What is the square root of 25?
questions.explanation: √25 = 5 and -5 because 5² = 25 and (-5)² = 25. Square roots have both positive and negative solutions.

questions.question: What does √16 equal?
questions.explanation: √16 = 4 (the principal square root). The radical symbol √ refers to the principal (positive) square root unless specified otherwise.

questions.question: What is the cube root of 8?
questions.explanation: ∛8 = 2 because 2³ = 2 × 2 × 2 = 8. Cube roots of positive numbers are positive, and cube roots of negative numbers are negative.

questions.question: Which expression is read as 'the cube root of 27'?
questions.explanation: ∛ is the cube root symbol. √ is the square root symbol. ∛27 means 'the cube root of 27.'

questions.question: What is √9?
questions.explanation: √9 = 3 (the principal square root). 3² = 9. The radical symbol gives the positive root.

questions.question: What is ∛(-64)?
questions.explanation: ∛(-64) = -4 because (-4)³ = (-4) × (-4) × (-4) = -64. Cube roots of negative numbers are negative.

questions.question: If x² = 36, what is x?
questions.explanation: x² = 36 means x = √36 or x = -√36, so x = 6 or x = -6. Both satisfy the equation.

questions.question: What is √0?
questions.explanation: √0 = 0 because 0² = 0. Zero is the only number whose square root is itself.

questions.question: A square has an area of 49 square units. What is its side length?
questions.explanation: Area = side², so side = √49 = 7 units. This shows a practical application of square roots.

questions.question: Which statement is TRUE?
questions.explanation: ∛(-8) = -2 is correct because (-2)³ = -8. Square roots of negative numbers aren't real numbers, and √25 = 5 (positive).

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You understand square roots, cube roots, and the difference between principal roots and all solutions.
scoreMessages.70: Good work! You grasp the basics but review the difference between √ (principal root) and solving x² = a.
scoreMessages.50: A fair attempt. Focus on: 1) √ gives positive root, 2) x² = a has two solutions, 3) ∛ of negative is negative.
scoreMessages.0: Keep practicing! Remember: √a gives the principal (positive) square root. x² = a has two solutions: x = √a and x = -√a.
